extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Endothermic Reaction in chemical reaction and Arc Reactor in Iron Man have similarities in utilizing external thermal energy to maintain or increase system stability
extended_metaphor.endothermic_reaction: Endothermic reactions absorb energy from the surroundings in the form of heat to fuel the reaction and maintain equilibrium. This process helps stabilize the system by absorbing heat energy from the surroundings.
extended_metaphor.arc_reactor: Similarly, the Arc Reactor in Iron Man absorbs external thermal energy to power the suit and facilitate changes in the internal system. It uses this heat transfer mechanism to maintain the stability of Iron Man's power source and overall functionality.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Endothermic Reaction in chemical reaction and Arc Reactor in Iron Man have similarities in consuming heat energy from surroundings to facilitate changes in internal system configuration
extended_metaphor.endothermic_reaction: Endothermic reactions require heat energy from the surroundings to drive the reaction forward and cause changes in the internal chemical configuration. By consuming heat energy, these reactions can proceed and alter the system's composition.
extended_metaphor.arc_reactor: Likewise, the Arc Reactor in Iron Man consumes heat energy from its environment to power the suit and make adjustments to the internal system configuration. This heat transfer process enables the Arc Reactor to optimize its functionality and adapt to different situations.
